header.title: Army’s guidelines to spot right-wing extremists include people calling themselves ‘patriots’
header.postText: Army officers are being given guidelines to spot right-wing extremists in their ranks.', 'A leaked leaflet titled ‘Extreme Right Wing (XRW) Indicators & Warnings’ includes a checklist of signs to look out for, such as people calling themselves ‘patriots’.', 'The pamphlet trains Army officials to look out for those who also make ‘inaccurate generalisations about the Left’ and seek to create ‘white only communities’.', 'A Ministry of Defence spokesperson confirmed to the MailOnline that the leaflet is genuine and that it has ‘robust measures in place’ to stop extremists from serving in the Armed Forces.', 'The leaflet was created in late 2017, the spokesperson confirmed to the news site, after four soldiers were arrested having been accused of links with neo-Nazi group National Action.', 'Corporal Mikko Vehvilainen, 34, was convicted in 2018 of being part of the terror group and was jailed for eight years.', 'He had been dismissed from the Armed Forces following his arrest in 2017, after attempting to create an underground network along with another British soldier.', 'The leaflet has since been leaked online to forum sites such as Reddit.', 'It advises senior officials to keep an eye on those who ‘use the term ‘Islamofascism’ and become ‘increasingly angry at perceived injustices of threats to so called national identity’.', 'Other warning signs include making generalisations about Muslims and Jews in an apparent ‘impending racial conflict or race war’.', 'An MoD spokesperson told MailOnline: ‘The values of our armed forces and the nation they serve are totally incompatible with extremist views.', '‘We have robust measures in place to ensure those exhibiting these views are not permitted to serve.’', '‘Exhibiting one or two of these in no way suggests someone is an extremist, and the card does not suggest that all patriots are extremists,’ the spokesperson added.', '‘Through the Government’s counter terrorism and counter extremism strategies (PREVENT) the MOD takes a comprehensive approach to tackling all forms of extremism and terrorism.’
